Identification_Area.title: The High Resolution Instrument (HRI) Visible CCD Imager for Deep Impact

Alias.alternate_title: DEEP IMPACT HIGH RESOLUTION INSTRUMENT - VISIBLE CCD
DEEP IMPACT HIGH RESOLUTION INSTRUMENT - VISIBLE CCD for DIF

Modification_Detail.description: Updated schema version. Adding missing "investigation" references. Update instrument type/subtype to use valid CTLI LDD.
Changed inst LIDs from u:n:p:c:i:instID.scID to u:n:p:c:i:scID.instID And per "Guide toPDS4 Context Products" v1.7, changed all lidvid_reference to lid_reference

Instrument.name: The High Resolution Instrument (HRI) Visible CCD Imager for Deep Impact
Instrument.description: The HRI telescope was a 30.0 cm, primary f/4.5 classical Cassegrain telescope with a dichroic beam splitter sitting in front of the telescope focal plane. Visible (0.3 to 1.0 microns) was directed through a filter wheel to a CCD detector for direct imaging. Equal transmission/reflection occured at about 1.05 microns on the beam splitter.The filter wheel contained two clear apertures and seven filters, roughly evenly spaced through the range coverage of the beam splitter reflectivity and CCD response (about 340 nm on the beam splitter end, and 960 nm on the CCD end). The field of view for the HRI visible imager was 2.0 milliradians.
